intro: Mercurialis ovata var. livida, commonly known as the dark mercury plant, is a variant of the common mercury plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae, characterized by its distinctive, dark green, almost black leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers clustered in complex inflorescences known as cyathia. It thrives in dry, sunny conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its striking appearance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens for ornamental purposes.
